column2: Ordering of the battleship HMS King George V

HMS King George V (pennant number 41) was the lead ship of the five British King George V-class battleships of the Royal Navy. King George V was built by Vickers-Armstrong at Walker Naval Yard, Newcastle upon Tyne
Ordering of the battleship HMS Prince Of Wales

Prince of Wales was originally named King Edward VIII but upon the abdication of Edward VIII the ship was renamed even before she had been laid down. This occurred at Cammell Laird's shipyard in Birkenhead on 1 January 1937
Ordering of the battleship HMS Duke Of York
Duke of York was the third ship in the King George V class, and was laid down at John Brown & Company's shipyard in Clydebank, Scotland, on 5 May 1937.
Ordering of the battleship HMS Anson
The keel of the fourth ship of the KGV class was laid at the Swan Hunter and Wigham Richardson Shipyard on 20 July 1937
Ordering of the battleship HMS Howe
The keel of the Howe, the last ship of the King George V class, was laid on 1 June 1937 at the Fairfield Shipyard in Govan
